Comment: For sure, but you could honestly point to Goldwater as the real genesis of what eventually even put Reagan in the White House to begin with. Goldwater tends to get brushed to the side a lot because he got trounced by LBJ as bad as he did, but there's a very clear connection between his kind of anti-government/libertarian message and Reaganism. Hell, his tendency for flippant commentary that seemed to not always appreciate the seriousness of the office is very proto-Trump to me.   Think it was Chris Wallace who said that he and the other young Republicans who came up in the Reagan years believed Goldwater had won, just 16 years late.

Comment: If, by some miracle of divine intervention, Josh & Gay win in Florida on Tuesday, Trump's Congressional coalition will **collapse** because House & Senate Republicans will finally become more worried about losing to a *Democrat* than losing to a Musk-financed primary opponent.  It **might** even happen if Josh & Gay lose by anything less than a landslide.  The fact that a Trump-annointed candidate (Randy Fine) is polling 4 points less than Josh Weil in a district that was R+30 for Trump is nothing short of **apocalyptic** for MAGA.  Once the dam starts to leak, you're going to see people like Jeb drop all pretense of polite non-opposition & go into full "flamethrower mode" against him.
